intro: Lachenalia argillicola, commonly known as the clay lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or clay soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
